page.title: 10TAVISTOCK WOODLANDS
page.content: Almost all the woods in this area are managed by{Tavistock Woodlands Estate. The owner is{The 7th Earl of Bradford and the manager is{Roy Dyer.}43 people work on the estate.In our area there are about 100 hectares of woodland but the estate is much larger. { }In our area there are both deciduous and coniferous woodland.The main species are Beech,Douglas Fir, Western Red Cedar,Larch,Scots Pine, Western Hemlock and Oak.About 30,000 trees a year are cut down and 70,000 planted. A new saw mill has just been opened. Most of the wood is sold to farmers and builders. {Mr.Dyer }said that the worst problem is rabbits.At Christmas some trees are stolen.There are also many old mine shafts in the woods.
